Row.Text: Corporations
Corporations Home Page
Corporations
[NEWLINE]"If you don't drive your business, you will be driven out of business."[NEWLINE] - B.C. Forbes[NEWLINE]

Trade and commerce has been a focal point of civilization since ancient times. Corporations are modern entities that authorizes a company or single group to act as a single entity. Corporations have become the largest facilitators of trade and influence in today's society. In Civilization V, Corporations allow you cement your civilization's wealth and deliver powerful trade benefits to your civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To establish a Corporation, you must secure a Global Monopoly on any of its required resources, and found its Corporation Headquarters. After your Corporation is established, you may construct Offices in your cities and use them to build Franchises in foreign cities via [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes.
Monopolies
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_MONOPOLY}

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopolies[ENDCOLOR] are one of the new gameplay elements added by the Community Balance Patch.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Luxury Global Monopolies[ENDCOLOR]: the essence of the Monopoly system is expansion: as your empire expands throughout the game (either through combat or settlement), be on the lookout for Luxury resources that you already have copies of. AS you collect more and more copies of the same Luxury Resources, the percentage of global resources you control goes up. If this value goes over 50% (i.e. you control more than 50% of the world's supply of any resource), you gain a Global Monopoly over that Resource. Each Global Monopoly has a unique bonus - some grant additional yields to your tiles, whereas others boost City yields by a set percentage (see the Resource section of the Civilopedia for details).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Global Monopolies[ENDCOLOR]: Strategic Resources operate the same way as Luxury Resources with regards to Monopolies, with one major exception. Due to the vast abundance of these resources, a true 50% Monopoly can be quite difficult. As a result, Strategic Resources have two tiers: 'Strategic' Monopolies and 'True' Monopolies. Strategic Monopolies occur at 25%, and generate special combat bonuses (such as increased health regeneration or increase defense). True Monopolies occur at 50% and, like Luxury Monopolies, they generate bonuses to City and/or tile yields.
What are Resource Monopolies?
Corporation HQs
Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION}

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] are one of the new gameplay elements added by the Community Balance Patch. They can have a great impact on your empire's economic development, especially in the later part of a game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Founding Corporations[ENDCOLOR]: There are seven distinct Corporations in the game, each of which becomes available once you have researched the Corporations Technology during the Modern Age. Each Corporation has a specific set of Resource Monopolies that it relies upon - if you do not have at least one of these Resource Monopolies, you will not be able to found the Corporation. Once these two requirements are met, you need to construct the 'Headquarters' of the Corporation in one of your Cities. These buildings are World Wonders, so only one player in the world may found each Corporation! Furthermore, once you have founded a Corporation, you cannot found another one, so make sure you like the one you pick![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Building Corporate Offices[ENDCOLOR]: Once you have founded your Corporation, you can begin establishing Corporate Offices in each of your Cities. These buildings come with special bonuses similar to your Corporation's Headquarters, and are thus worthwhile to construct on their own. Most bonuses from Corporations scale with the number of Cities you own, so larger empires benefit greatly from founding a Corporation and building as many Offices as possible!
What is a Corporation?
Spreading Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_SPREADING}

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spreading your Corporation[ENDCOLOR]: to foreign cities is an essential element of reaping the most benefit from your Corporation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Active Spread: Corporations actively spread their influence via owned Trade Routes, but only if the origin City (your City) has a Corporate Office in it. If your City has a Corporate Office, and you send a Trade Route from that City to a foreign City, a Corporate 'Franchise' will be built in that foreign City when the Trade Route completes. There is also a random chance (~5%) that a Franchise will be created in a nearby Foreign city each turn, if you are currently trading with that Civilization. You can only spread your Corporation to each foreign City once, and you cannot have more Franchises than the maximum number of Trade Routes you can support.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Passive Spread: Corporations passively spread their influence via foreign Trade Routes, but only if the destination City (your City) has a Corporate Office in it. If your City has a Corporate Office, and another player sends a Trade Route to that City from one of their Cities, a Corporate 'Franchise' will be built in the foreign City when their Trade Route completes. Your Corporation can only spread to each foreign City once.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Benefits of Spreading Your Corporation[ENDCOLOR]: As listed in the details of each Corporation, the spread of your Corporation to foreign cities has a direct impact on the productivity of your Corporate Offices. For every 'Franchise' of your Corporation in a foreign City, your Corporate Offices gain unique bonuses, be it additional City yields, free resources, or improved Trade Route yields. Furthermore, many Corporations gain additional bonuses if you send Trade Routes to foreign Cities that already have your Corporation in them. Make sure to study the details of your Corporation once you have founded it so that you can maximize your benefit![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Managing your Corporation[ENDCOLOR]: As your Corporation grows, it can be hard to keep up with where you have Franchises, and where you have Offices. Never fear! In the Economic Overview panel, you can find detailed information on your Corporation in the bottom-left corner. There, you can see the total number of Offices and Corporations you currently control, as well as drop-down lists of the locations of all Corporate Offices and Franchises, as well as the size of foreign Corporations. In addition to these elements, you can also find information about your Corporation while choosing a destination for your Trade Routes. Each City with a Franchise in it is clearly indicated.
How do I spread my Corporation?
Corporation Types
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_TYPES}

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporation Types[ENDCOLOR]: there are seven Corporations avaialable in the Community Balance Patch. Each of these can only be constructed once (and only one per player), so choose wisely! For more on this, see the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] Tab of the Civilopedia.
How do I spread my Corporation?
Corporation

Monopoly Required (Any)
Monopoly Resource
Corporations & Monopolies
Founding Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_FOUNDING}

In order to establish a Corporation, you need to construct its associated Headquarters in one of your cities, and the Corporation must not be actively founded by another civilization. Headquarters may only be established after you have a Global Monopoly on one of its required Monopoly Resources. Once you've constructed the Headquarters, you will automatically found the Corporation and immediately receive its Corporation benefits. You also receive a free Office in the city that constructed it. You can only establish one Corporation at a time, so choose carefully!
How do I found a Corporation?
Destroying Corporations
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_DESTROYING}

When a city that has constructed a Corporation Headquarters is acquired or destroyed through any means by another civilization, that Corporation is immediately destroyed. All Offices and Franchises around the world are immediately closed, and the founding Civilization immediately loses all benefits from that Corporation. It is extremely important to protect your Corporation, as you will lose all of your progress in spreading that Corporation![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A destroyed Corporation immediately becomes available to be founded again by any civilization in the world. There is no restriction in the number of times a Corporation may be established in a game.
How do I destroy a Corporation?
Offices
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_OFFICES}

Offices can be established in any of your empire's cities after you've established a Corporation. Offices allow you to spread your Corporation through [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes. Each [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route you establish from a city with an Office to a foreign city without your Corporation's Franchise will spread your Corporation's Franchise to that city at the completion of the [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route. In addition to a base effect, each Office has a benefit that stacks based on the number of Franchises you've established in foreign cities. The more Offices you own in the empire, the faster your Corporation can spread. Spread your Corporation to enhance its benefit to your Civilization!
What is an office?
Franchises
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_FRANCHISES}

Franchises cannot be constructed in any city. Instead they are created after a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route from a city you own with an Office to a foreign city that does not already contain your Corporation's Franchise is completed. Franchises increase the Empire's overall Office benefit, so use them to strengthen your Corporation's effect. You can only build a maximum number of Franchises, determined by the size of the map, the number of [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes you can establish, and any bonuses from any [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policies you have unlocked.
What are franchises?
Monopolies
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_MONOPOLIES}

Monopolies represent the amount of a particular Luxury or Strategic Resource you own vs. the amount of that resource on the map. As you obtain more copies of a resource, your Monopoly Percentage will increase. If you obtain 50% or more of a Monopoly over a resource, you obtain a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly[ENDCOLOR] over that resource. Obtaining a Global Monopoly grants a unique bonus per resource, so you should make it a priority to obtain Monopolies over as many Resources as possible.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Due to the vast abundance of Strategic Resources, it can be difficult to obtain a 50% Monopoly over a Strategic Resource. Because of this, you can also obtain a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT] Strategic Monopoly[ENDCOLOR] at 25% Monopoly, which grants a special combat bonus (different for each resource). You can still achieve a Global Monopoly at 50% Monopoly for a Strategic Resource.
What are Monopolies?
Spreading your Corporation
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_SPREAD}

You can spread your Corporation through [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from a city with your Corporation's Office built to a foreign city without a Corporation Franchise built. At the completion of the [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route, a Franchise will be constructed. There is also a random chance every turn (around 5%) that a Franchise will be constructed in a nearby foriegn City, if you are trading with that Civilization already.
How do I spread my Corporation?
Resource Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_RESOURCE_BONUS}

Most Corporations have a resource bonus which applies to all Cities with a Corporation Franchise. Each resource bonus provides a bonus to a specific yield, such as [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, or [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
What is a resource bonus?
Office Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_OFFICE_BONUS}
Your Corporation Offices receive incremental affects the more Franchises you establish in foreign cities, so be sure to keep spreading your Corporation to reap its benefits!
What is an office bonus?
Trade Route Bonus
{TXT_KEY_TOPIC_CORPORATION_TRADE_ROUTE_BONUS}

All Corporations provide some benefit to your [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes. These bonuses generally affect your [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade benefits to cities that have your Corporation Franchise already established, but they may also grant some sort of special benefit (like increase trade distance, or invulnerable trade units).
What is a trade route bonus?

It is now possible to found a Corporation! Check the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations and Monopolies[ENDCOLOR] screen for information on your current Resource Monopolies, all possible Corporations, and the Corporations that you are eligible for.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Construct the Corporation's HQ in one of your Cities to found it! Remember that you can only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make it count!
Corporations Enabled!

You have founded [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_CorporationName}[ENDCOLOR]! To spread your new Corporation far and wide, build Corporate Offices in owned Cities and send [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from these Cities to foreign Cities!
Corporation Founded!

{@2_BldgName}, a foreign Corporation, has spread to the City of {@1_City} as a result of a Trade Route with {@3_City}. This will increase the value of their Corporation!

Corporations

Corporations are powerful, late-game entities that are only available to Civilizations with Global Resource Monopolies. For more information, see the Civilopedia Concepts section on Coroporations, and the Wonders tab.

Monopolies & Corporations
Corporations

The word "corporation" derives from corpus, the Latin word for body, or a body of people. By the time of Justinian (reigned 527–565), Roman Law recognized a range of corporate entities under the names universitas, corpus or collegium. These included the state itself (the populus Romanus), municipalities, and such private associations as sponsors of a religious cult, burial clubs, political groups, and guilds of craftsmen or traders. Such bodies commonly had the right to own property and make contracts, to receive gifts and legacies, to sue and be sued, and, in general, to perform legal acts through representatives. Private associations were granted designated privileges and liberties by the emperor.
Allows you to found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR], which are powerful late-game institutions that greatly enhance your Trade Routes and global power if you invest in their expansion.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The point is ladies and gentlemen that greed, for lack of a better word, is good."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Gordon Gekko[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Merchandising, merchandising, where the real money from the movie is made."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Yogurt[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Lesson number one: Don't underestimate the other guy's greed."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Frank Lopez[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I just want to say one word to you. Just one word: Plastics."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mr. McGuire[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Fashion is about dreaming and making other people dream."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Donatella Versace[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Whatever good things we build end up building us."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Jim Rohn[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"There is no love sincerer than the love of food."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - George Bernard Shaw[NEWLINE][TAB]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Will the people in the cheaper seats clap your hands? And the rest of you, if you'll just rattle your jewelry."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - John Lennon[NEWLINE][TAB]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nationalization[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each Corporate Office counts as two Franchises, and Corporate [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route bonuses to cities with Franchises are doubled. Foreign Franchises no longer benefit your Corporation, you can no longer construct Franchises in foreign Cities, and foreign Corporations can no longer set up Franchises in your Cities. +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from all Corporation Offices.
Nationalization

Nationalization is the process of taking a private industry or private assets into public ownership by a national government or state. Nationalization usually refers to private assets, but may also mean assets owned by lower levels of government, such as municipalities, being transferred to be the state. The opposite of nationalization is usually privatization or de-nationalization, but may also be municipalization. Industries that are usually subject to nationalization include transport, communications, energy, banking and natural resources.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Transnationalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each turn, increases the a chance that a Corporate Franchise will appear in a foreign City to 15% (normally 5%). Global Franchise maximum increased by 25%. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from all Corporation Offices.
Transnationalism

Transnationalism as an economic process involves the global reorganization of the production process, in which various stages of the production of any product can occur in various countries, typically with the aim of minimizing costs. Economic transnationalism, commonly known as Globalization, was spurred in the latter half of the 20th century by the development of the internet and wireless communication, as well as the reduction in global transportation costs caused by containerization. Multinational corporations could be seen as a form of transnationalism, in that they seek to minimize costs, and hence maximize profits, by organizing their operations in the most efficient means possible irrespective of political boundaries.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Syndicalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Corporate Franchises count double in the Cities of Civilizations you are at least [COLOR_MAGENTA]Popular[ENDCOLOR] with, and this extra Franchise does not count against your Global Franchise maximum. Can establish 5 additional Franchises in foreign Cities. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from all Corporation Offices.
Syndicalism

National syndicalism is an adaptation of syndicalism to suit the social agenda of integral nationalism. National syndicalism suggests that the people must defend themselves through the development of Syndicalist sections into massive economic worker movements. These should take immediate action to expropriate the capitalists. These should also take direct action to let the workers lead the production and to form peoples communes. National syndicalism seeks out principled reasons for direct economic action and denounces parliamentary action by representatives. The goal is not to make capitalism bearable, but the realisation of a free Nationalist and Socialist nation. National syndicalism aims to move the attention from the political terrain to the economic terrain. It wants the socialisation from the basis: a system of distribution from local units, in consultation with the National federation, on the fundament of a production and consumption statistic. As well as the organisation of the production by national industrial federations.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I don't build in order to have clients. I have clients in order to build."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Howard Roark[NEWLINE][TAB]
Trader Sid's, Inc.

Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_GOLD] Gold generation. Increases [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Unit limit by two and doubles Land [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Unit maximum distance.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Caravansaries and Markets in all Cities produce +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Every Franchise in a foreign Civilization's Cities increases your [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with them by 2%.

[ICON_RES_CLOVES] Cloves, [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RES_NUTMEG] Nutmeg, [ICON_RES_PEPPER] Pepper, [ICON_RES_SALT] Salt, [ICON_RES_SPICES] Cinnamon, [ICON_RES_SUGAR] Sugar provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all Cities with a Trader Sid's Franchise.
+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Global Franchise, and [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to this City generate +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes from owned Cities with a Trader Sid's Office to foreign Cities with a Trader Sid's Franchise produce +25% additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Current Office Bonus: {1_String}
Trader Sid's Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

Construct this building in one of your cities to found the Trader Sid's Corporation. See the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] section of the Civilopedia for more information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] See the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] section of the Civilopedia for more information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!
Founds the Trader Sid's, Inc. Corporation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive a free Trader Sid's Office in this City, and unlocks construction of Trader Sid's Offices in owned Cities.
Trader Sid's

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

This building can only be constructed in Foreign Cities if you were the founder of Trader Sid's. To construct this building in a foreign City, send a Trade Route from an owned City with a Trader Sid's Office in it to a foreign City. When the Trade Route is complete, the building will automatically be constructed.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on all Trader Sid's Monopoly Resources near the City. Generates revenue for Trader Sid's Offices in the founding Civilization's Cities.
Trader Sid's Office

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

When a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route between a foreign City and this City completes, a Trader Sid's Franchise is constructed in the foreign City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trader Sid's cannot be sold or destroyed by the player, and increases the [ICON_GOLD] Gold output of all Trader Sid's Offices by +4.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot have more Franchises than your Franchise Limit (see the Corporation and Monopolies Overview for more on this).

Incoming [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes generate +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the City, and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for Trade Route owner. +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Trader Sid's Franchise in foreign Cities (up to your Franchise Limit).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade Routes from this City to foreign Cities with a Trader Sid's Franchise produce +25% more [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Centaurus Extractors, Inc.

Provides benefits geared toward [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and coastal Cities. Increases [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Unit limit by two and doubles sea [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Unit maximum range.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Harbors and Seaports in all Cities also produce +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Every Franchise in a foreign Civilization's Cities increases your [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with them by 2%.
[ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses, [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales, [ICON_RES_CRAB] Crab, [ICON_RES_IVORY] Ivory provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities with Centaurus Extractors Franchise.
+3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every Global Franchise, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Sea Tiles near the City.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to a foreign City with a Centaurus Extractors Franchise grant +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science rate in the origin City.
Current Office Bonus: {1_String}
Centaurus Extractors Headquarters

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

Construct this building in one of your cities to found the Centaurus Extractor's Corporation. See the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] section of the Civilopedia for more information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] See the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Corporations[ENDCOLOR] section of the Civilopedia for more information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Remember that each Civilization may only found [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]one[ENDCOLOR] Corporation, so make sure the benefits are applicable to your Victory Strategy!
Founds the Centaurus Extractors Corporation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants a free Centaurus Extractors Office in this City, and unlocks construction of Centaurus Extractors Offices in owned Cities.
Centaurus Extractors

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

This building can only be constructed in Foreign Cities if you were the founder of Centaurus Extractors. To construct this building in a foreign City, send a Trade Route from an owned City with a Centaurus Extractors Office in it to a foreign City. When the Trade Route is complete, the building will automatically be constructed.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Monopoly Resources associated with Centaurus Extractors. Generates revenue for Centaurus Extractors Offices in the founding Civilization's Cities.
Centaurus Extractors Office

A corporation is a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law. Early incorporated entities were established by charter (i.e. by an ad hoc act granted by a monarch or passed by a parliament or legislature). Most jurisdictions now allow the creation of new corporations through registration. Corporations come in many different types but are usually divided by the law of the jurisdiction where they are chartered into two kinds: by whether or not they can issue stock, or by whether or not they are for profit.

When a [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route between a foreign City and this City completes, a Centaurus Extractors Franchise is constructed in the foreign City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Centaurus Extractors cannot be sold or destroyed by the player, and increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of all Centaurus Extractors Offices by +3.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot have more Franchises than your Franchise Limit (see the Corporation and Monopolies Overview for more on this).

+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Sea Tiles near this City. +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every Centaurus Extractors Franchise (up to your Franchise Limit).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Every Trade Route from this City to a foreign City with a Centaurus Extractors Franchise increases this City's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science rate by +10%.
Hexxon Refinery, Inc.

Provides bonuses that enhance your ability to wage late-game warfare and amass Strategic Resources. Increases [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Unit limit by two.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all Units that require [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil, [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium, or [ICON_RES_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to build. +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Coal, Nuclear, Wind, and Solar Plants. Every Franchise in a foreign Civilization's Cities increases your [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with them by 2%.

[ICON_RES_COAL] Coal, [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil, [ICON_RES_INCENSE] Incense, [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium, and [ICON_RES_BRAZILWOOD] Brazilwood provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities with Hexxon Refineries Franchises.
+1 additional [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal for every three Global Franchises, and +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Military Units.
[ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes to a foreign City with a Hexxon Refinery Franchise grant +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in origin City.
Current Office Bonus: {1_String}
